description: A helmet made from a soup pot.  It's not very good protection, but it's better than nothing.

An enclosed helmet made from a stock pot with a 'T' crudely carved into the front and a blanket stuffed inside to cushion it.  There are strings tied to the handles to help fasten it to your body, but it's extremely limiting and smothering.
Lightweight sports headgear designed to protect the head while sparring.
A heavy helmet that provides excellent protection from all sorts of damage.  It is labeled as the advanced combat helmet.

pocket_data.description: Pocket for a face shield or a shield visor.
Pocket for a strapped mandible guard.

description: An all-encompassing black helmet that covers your entire face and neck, providing excellent protection from all sorts of damage.
A lightweight black helmet that provides excellent protection from all sorts of damage.  It has a military rail system for attachments.

pocket_data.description: Pocket for a face shield or a shield visor.
Pocket for a rail-mounted mandible guard.

description: A distinctive helmet worn by firefighters.  More than just a piece of firefighting equipment, it serves as a badge of honor and respect.
A hard plastic helmet that covers the head and ears.  Designed to protect against a baseball to the head.
A medieval helmet that provides excellent protection for the head, with a Y shaped opening for the face.
A medieval helmet that provides excellent protection for the head, with a Y shaped opening for the face.  This one is ogre sized.
A medieval helmet that provides excellent protection for the head, with a Y shaped opening for the face.  This one is goblin sized.
A thick foam helmet.  Designed to protect against concussion.

pocket_data.description: Pocket for a strapped mandible guard.

description: A helmet made from the exoskeletons of insects.  Covers the entire head; very light and durable.
A helmet made from giant insects for giant humanoids.
A helmet made from the exoskeletons of insects.  Covering the entire head, it is very light and durable.
A conical iron helm with additional protection for the neck, associated with the Mongol Empire.
A helmet made for a giant Mongolian warrior from a pulp novel.
A conical iron helm with additional protection for the neck, associated with the Mongol Empire.
A helmet crafted from the carefully cleaned and pruned biosilicified exoskeletons of acidic ants.  Acid-resistant but brittle.
A helmet made from giant acidic insects for giant humanoids.
A helmet crafted from the carefully cleaned and pruned biosilicified exoskeletons of acidic ants.  Acid-resistant but brittle.
A heavy polycarbonate helmet normally worn by football players.  It comes with a visor to protect the eyes.
An Imperial Roman helmet, with distinct projections protecting the sides of the head.
An Imperial Roman helmet, with distinct projections protecting the sides of the head built for a Titan.
An Imperial Roman helmet, with distinct projections protecting the sides of the head.

//: Leaving this at $500 as it's either antique/priceless or player-made/Bartered, leastwise on the initial search.
description: A medieval Japanese helmet with a scowling facemask that provides excellent protection to the entire head and face.
A medieval Japanese helmet with a scowling facemask, fit for an Oni.
A medieval Japanese helmet with a scowling facemask that provides excellent protection to the entire head and face.
A thick leather helmet that provides excellent protection for the head.
A thick leather helmet that provides excellent protection for the head.  This one is quite large.
A thick leather helmet that provides excellent protection for the head.

The top part of a large wolf skull, equipped with leather straps to secure it on your head.  Every inch of the skull has been carved with a maze of fine, intertwined symbols that make your eyes water.
A cloth liner worn inside a helmet to help keep your head warm in cold climates.
A helmet with covers for the head and chin, leaving space in-between for you to wear goggles.  Activate to raise the visor.

//: Can't use copy-from and armor_portion_data at the same time, clear up this item once #43144 will be merged
description: A helmet with covers for the head and chin, leaving space in-between for you to wear goggles.  The visor is raised.  Activate to put down the visor.
An early medieval helmet with a projection guarding the nose, to better protect the face without obstructing vision.  Proper viking gear, unlike the stereotypical horned helm.
An early medieval helmet with a projection guarding the nose, to better protect the face without obstructing vision.  Proper Jotunn gear, unlike the stereotypical horned helm.
An early medieval helmet with a projection guarding the nose, to better protect the face without obstructing vision.  Proper viking gear, unlike the stereotypical horned helm.
A medieval helmet that provides excellent protection to the entire head, at the cost of great encumbrance.
A medieval helmet that provides excellent protection to the entire head, at the cost of great encumbrance.  Larger than average.
A medieval helmet that provides excellent protection to the entire head, at the cost of great encumbrance.  Smaller than average.
A wide-brimmed helmet that looks somewhat like a metal cowboy hat.  Sadly, it won't help protect your eyes from the sun.
A wide-brimmed helmet that looks somewhat like a metal cowboy hat.  Sadly, it won't help protect your eyes from the sun.  This one is larger than average.
A helmet made from scraps of metal secured by simple strings; the loose collection of plates provides decent but not the most convenient protection.
An oversized helmet made from scraps of metal secured by simple strings.
A helmet made from scraps of metal secured by simple strings; the loose collection of plates provides decent but not the most convenient protection.

Massively heavy, extremely uncomfortable, very crude, and looks like a bucket with a slit cut out the front, but it'll keep zombie claws off your face.  Comes with a bevor to help spread the weight out onto your shoulders and protect your neck, and some cloth padding to keep your bell from being rung.
//: The weight assumes one large sheet of about 75cm x 40cm x 1.5mm and one circular sheet with a diameter of 24cm as the crown, and one gambeson hood.

name.str: case hardened sheet metal great helm

description: It still looks like a bucket, but this crude great helm has at least been case hardened for extra protection.
A helmet that looks like a crude bucket with the face cut out.  It comes with a bevor to distribute some of the weight to your shoulders, as well as cloth padding to keep your bell from being rung.
//: The weight assumes one large sheet of about 75cm x 40cm x 1.5mm and one circular sheet with a diameter of 24cm as the crown, and one gambeson hood, but minus the weight of a 25cm x 30cm face cut out.

description: While the design is crude, this helmet has been case hardened for added protection, while still leaving your face open so you can see properly.
A small metal helmet that covers the head and protects against cuts and percussion.
A spiked helmet once worn by German military officers.  The spike is very sharp.

description: An ancient Greek bronze helmet that provides excellent protection for the head, with slits for the eyes and mouth.
An ancient Greek bronze helmet that provides excellent protection for the head, with slits for the eyes and mouth.  Of godlike proportions.
An ancient Greek bronze helmet that provides excellent protection for the head, with slits for the eyes and mouth.
A solid, single piece closed bronze helmet with a slit for the eyes.
A huge makeshift helmet made from a canning pot.  For the truly desperate man-bear-pig.
A helmet made from a soup pot.  It's not very good protection, but it's better than nothing.
A type of helmet that was developed in the late 15th century.  Evolving from the sallet and armet, it includes a bevor to protect the neck.  Activate it to raise the visor.
